newsitem.title: USA: FP&L 666 MW Fla. nuke restart postponed.
newsitem.headline: FP&L 666 MW Fla. nuke restart postponed.

text.p: Florida Power & Light Co (FP&L) has postponed startup of its 666 megawatt Turkey Point nuclear power unit 4 to late Thursday or early Friday, a company spokesman said.
"We're looking at either later today or early tomorrow," spokesman Bill Swank said Thursday.
The Florida City, Fla., unit was shut Monday for repairs to a feedwater heater and had originally been set to restart October 23.
Although the unit should restart Thursday or Friday, it will take several hours before it is resynchronized to the electricity grid, the spokesman said.
The neighboring Turkey Point unit 3, also with 666 megawatts, was producing at full capacity.
FP&L is the owner and operator of the Turkey Point units.
-- Chris Reese, New York Power Desk 212-859-1627
